speaker: DUKE FREDERICK
text_entry: SCENE III. Before OLIVER'S house.

speaker: DUKE FREDERICK
text_entry: Enter ORLANDO and ADAM, meeting

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Who's there?

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: What, my young master? O, my gentle master!

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: O my sweet master! O you memory

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Of old Sir Rowland! why, what make you here?

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Why are you virtuous? why do people love you?

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: And wherefore are you gentle, strong and valiant?

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Why would you be so fond to overcome

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: The bonny priser of the humorous duke?

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Your praise is come too swiftly home before you.

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Know you not, master, to some kind of men

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Their graces serve them but as enemies?

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: No more do yours: your virtues, gentle master,

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Are sanctified and holy traitors to you.

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: O, what a world is this, when what is comely

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Envenoms him that bears it!

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Why, what's the matter?

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: O unhappy youth!

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Come not within these doors; within this roof

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: The enemy of all your graces lives:

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Your brother--no, no brother; yet the son--

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Yet not the son, I will not call him son

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Of him I was about to call his father--

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Hath heard your praises, and this night he means

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: To burn the lodging where you use to lie

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: And you within it: if he fail of that,

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: He will have other means to cut you off.

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: I overheard him and his practises.

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: This is no place; this house is but a butchery:

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Abhor it, fear it, do not enter it.

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Why, whither, Adam, wouldst thou have me go?

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: No matter whither, so you come not here.

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: What, wouldst thou have me go and beg my food?

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Or with a base and boisterous sword enforce

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: A thievish living on the common road?

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: This I must do, or know not what to do:

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Yet this I will not do, do how I can;

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: I rather will subject me to the malice

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Of a diverted blood and bloody brother.

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: But do not so. I have five hundred crowns,

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: The thrifty hire I saved under your father,

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Which I did store to be my foster-nurse

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: When service should in my old limbs lie lame

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: And unregarded age in corners thrown:

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Take that, and He that doth the ravens feed,

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Yea, providently caters for the sparrow,

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Be comfort to my age! Here is the gold;

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: And all this I give you. Let me be your servant:

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Though I look old, yet I am strong and lusty;

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: For in my youth I never did apply

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Hot and rebellious liquors in my blood,

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Nor did not with unbashful forehead woo

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: The means of weakness and debility;

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Therefore my age is as a lusty winter,

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Frosty, but kindly: let me go with you;

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: I'll do the service of a younger man

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: In all your business and necessities.

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: O good old man, how well in thee appears

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: The constant service of the antique world,

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: When service sweat for duty, not for meed!

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Thou art not for the fashion of these times,

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Where none will sweat but for promotion,

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: And having that, do choke their service up

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Even with the having: it is not so with thee.

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: But, poor old man, thou prunest a rotten tree,

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: That cannot so much as a blossom yield

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: In lieu of all thy pains and husbandry

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: But come thy ways; well go along together,

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: And ere we have thy youthful wages spent,

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: We'll light upon some settled low content.

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Master, go on, and I will follow thee,

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: To the last gasp, with truth and loyalty.

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: From seventeen years till now almost fourscore

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Here lived I, but now live here no more.

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: At seventeen years many their fortunes seek;

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: But at fourscore it is too late a week:

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Yet fortune cannot recompense me better

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Than to die well and not my master's debtor.

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Exeunt
